segments.text: Glancing at this kitchen, everything looks so ordinary at first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is focused on her plate, towel in hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that sink—ugh, the water is just wasting away, overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's disgusting how it's soaking the cabinets and floor without anyone caring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot in the puddle? Gross, she'll track it everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids—sneaking cookies, what a sneaky, grubby thing to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy balancing on that stool, hands in the jar—filthy if he's not washed up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl begging for one, like little thieves in their own home.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is sloppy and inconsiderate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the window to the clean garden can't redeem this mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel repulsed by the carelessness of it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Who leaves a faucet running like that? Nasty.
segments.speaker: PAR
